definition: peaceful/quiet/tranquil/purified of defiling illusion (Buddhism)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
clean/completely/only/net (income, exports etc)/(Chinese opera) painted face male role
lit. ears pure and peaceful (idiom)/to stay away from the filth and unrest of the world

sentences.english: Unique peace and quiet dispersant and antioxidant.
sentences.chinese: 獨特的清淨分散劑和抗氧化劑。

sentences.english: Keep the mind pure and undefiled. Remain calm and serene always.
sentences.chinese: 守住清淨無爲的心，讓心時時寂靜。

sentences.english: All sentient beings have the ability to realize and actualize the Dharma, a completely pure state of being.
sentences.chinese: 所有衆生皆可證入法，那樣的境界是完全清淨的。

sentences.english: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows him like his never-departing shadow.
sentences.chinese: 若人以清淨之心言行，快樂將跟隨着他，如影隨形。

sentences.english: Mody? We must maintain an integrity of nature and a pure heart.
sentences.chinese: 麼？我們一定要保有一顆完整的本性和一顆清淨的心。

sentences.english: Learn to develop pure and unconditional love;
sentences.chinese: 要培養一分清淨無染的愛。

sentences.english: When a meditator has gained deep concentration of mind, his mind is purified.
sentences.chinese: 當修行者獲得較深的定力時，他的心變得清淨。

sentences.english: In his library he had been always sure of leisure and tranquillity ;
sentences.chinese: 他平常待在書房裏就是爲了要圖個悠閒清淨。

sentences.english: The Buddhas or Tathagatas abandon every possible fault or obscuration and then, through their great realizations, achieve the pure vision.
sentences.chinese: 佛就是淨除了一切過失或無明以大智慧證得清淨之見。

sentences.english: Especialy it helps to raise clarifying effect and economic efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 對於提高清淨效果和經濟效益具有一定作用。

sentences.english: The experiments of using chitosan flocculant in syrup floating purification of the afination raw sugar is introduced in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 用殼聚糖絮凝劑對復篩原糖漿進行氣浮清淨試驗。

sentences.english: I want to go back when it's quieter / I want to go back when it's quieter.
sentences.chinese: 我想等它清淨一些的時候再去看看。

sentences.english: The foaming properties of metallic detergents in different internal-combustion engine oils were mainly studies.
sentences.chinese: 金屬清淨劑在不同的基礎油中抗泡性能各不相同。

sentences.english: The number is equal to about two-thirds of the world's population, leaving few corners of the globe where public spaces are free of mobile-tethered babblers.
sentences.chinese: 整個世界的公共空間只有少數幾個角落是清淨的了。

sentences.english: I want to go back when it is quieter.
sentences.chinese: 我想等它清淨一些的時候再去看看。

sentences.english: At the same time release me from my sorrow, who have lived in perfect wholesomeness .
sentences.chinese: 同時讓我這個身心清淨者解脫悲傷。

definition: all living things
quiet/peaceful and quiet
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Bodhisattva (Buddhism)
to vow

actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to instruct (novices)/to preach/to teach/to reveal
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
Anning District of Lanzhou City 蘭州市|兰州市[Lan2 zhou1 Shi4], Gansu/Anning City, to the west of Kunming 昆明[Kun1 ming2], Yunnan
peaceful/tranquil/calm/composed/free from worry
to untie/to free/to absolve of/to get free of/to extirpate oneself/(Buddhism) to free oneself of worldly worries
anatta (Buddhist concept of "non-self")
to become enlightened (Buddhism)
the Three Precious Treasures of Buddhism, namely: the Buddha 佛, the Dharma 法 (his teaching), and the Sangha 僧 (his monastic order)
still/calm/quiet/not moving
